description: old man wearing a dark suite and a light-colored ivy cap and a young woman with dark hair, looking over a wall toward a grassy bank with water at right; signpost with pointing fingers: "TO VILLAGE at left and "TO GERMANY" at right
inscription: verso in black ink: ENGLAND / SIGN SAY TO GERMANY WHERE / ENGLISH UNEMPLOYED ARE GOING / LOOKING FOR WORK
markings: verso, stamped in black: TIRAGE ARCHIVES / MAGNUM PHOTOS / 20, rue des Grandes Augustins / 75006 PARIS / EPREUVE A RENDRE | verso, stamped in black: VINTAGE PRINT | verso, stamped in blue: © Leonard Freed-Magnum
title: A sign post at Seaburn is pointing to Germany and seems an invitation for all unemployed skilled men to go there and find work, Sunderland, England
